Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= process by which deities or humans experience an emotion of anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible, and almost exclusively used with God as the subject

Node.gloss: to turn away|to come to an end|to cease|to subside
Node.definition: literally: (an event) turns away (from someone); hence: = process by which a certain condition comes to an end
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be unsuspecting|to be secure
Node.definition: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
poetic term: = words set to music|= a deity that is the source of someone's strength
= short form of יהוה (יהוה) only found in poetic texts
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
= causative action by which humans let down a bucket like container attached to a rope into a well in order to draw water from it
= an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= an activity performed by a person or deity
= causative action by which humans or deities cause information that is stored in someone else's mind to be reprocessed by speaking about it
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans shout ◄ for joy or because of grief ► to give vent to their feelings
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
